info.title: Deep Thought CDR API
info.description: This is the Deep Thought CDR API. It combines all of the separate API services into a single service. You can find out more about Deep Thought at [https://github.com/bizaio/deepthought](https://github.com/bizaio/deepthought) or on the [DataRight.io Slack, #oss](https://join.slack.com/t/datarightio/shared_invite/enQtNzAyNTI2MjA2MzU1LTU1NGE4MmQ2N2JiZWI2ODA5MTQ2N2Q0NTRmYmM0OWRlM2U5YzA3NzU5NDYyODlhNjRmNzU3ZDZmNTI0MDE3NjY).

get.description:
Obtain transactions for a specific account.

Some general notes that apply to all end points that retrieve transactions:

- Where multiple transactions are returned, transactions should be ordered according to effective date in descending order
- As the date and time for a transaction can alter depending on status and transaction type two separate date/times are included in the payload. There are still some scenarios where neither of these time stamps is available. For the purpose of filtering and ordering it is expected that the data holder will use the “effective” date/time which will be defined as:
		- Posted date/time if available, then
		- Execution date/time if available, then
		- A reasonable date/time nominated by the data holder using internal data structures
- For transaction amounts it should be assumed that a negative value indicates a reduction of the available balance on the account while a positive value indicates an increase in the available balance on the account
- For aggregated transactions (ie. groups of sub transactions reported as a single entry for the account) only the aggregated information, with as much consistent information accross the subsidiary transactions as possible, is required to be shared

parameters.name: x-v
parameters.description: Version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer.

parameters.name: x-min-v
parameters.description: Minimum version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer if provided.

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: An RFC4122 UUID used as a correlation id. If provided, the data holder must play back this value in the x-fapi-interaction-id response header. If not provided a [RFC4122] UUID value is required to be provided in the response header to track the interaction.

parameters.name: x-fapi-auth-date
parameters.description: The data/time when the customer last logged in to the data recipient.

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The customer's original IP address if the customer is currently logged in to the data recipient.

parameters.name: x-cds-client-headers
parameters.description: The customer's original standard http headers Base64 encoded, including the original User Agent header, if the customer is currently logged in to the data recipient.

x-v.description: The version of the API end point that the data holder has responded with.

x-fapi-interaction-id.description: An RFC4122 UUID used as a correlation id.

get.description: Obtain basic information on the customer that has authorised the current session
Obtain detailed information on the authorised customer within the current session.
Obtain a list of scheduled outages for the implementation
Obtain a health check status for the implementation
Obtain a list of products available from the Data Holder

200.description: Successful Response containing list of requested objects

get.description: Returns details product information based on the specified product identifier

404.description: Requested Object could not be found

accountId.description: ID of the account for which transactions are provided

transactionId.description: A unique ID of the transaction adhering to the standards for ID permanence.

isDetailAvailable.description: True if extended information is available using the transaction detail end point. False if extended data is not available

description.description: The transaction description as applied by the financial institution

postingDateTime.description: The time the transaction was posted. This field is Mandatory if the transaction has status POSTED.  This is the time that appears on a standard statement

valueDateTime.description: Date and time at which assets become available to the account owner in case of a credit entry, or cease to be available to the account owner in case of a debit transaction entry

executionDateTime.description: The time the transaction was executed by the originating customer, if available

amount.description: The value of the transaction. Negative values mean money was outgoing from the account

currency.description: The currency for the transaction amount. AUD assumed if not present

reference.description: The reference for the transaction provided by the originating institution. Empty string if no data provided

merchantName.description: Name of the merchant for an outgoing payment to a merchant

billerCode.description: BPAY Biller Code for the transaction (if available)

billerName.description: Name of the BPAY biller for the transaction (if available)

crn.description: BPAY CRN for the transaction (if available)

self.description: Fully qualified link that generated the current response document

first.description: URI to the first page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

prev.description: URI to the previous page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the prev page

next.description: URI to the next page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

last.description: URI to the last page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the full set.

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in the full set.

ResponseBankingTransactionListDataV1.description: Object containing a list of BankingTransaction objects

payer.description: Label of the originating payer. Mandatory for inbound payment

payee.description: Label of the target PayID.  Mandatory for an outbound payment. The name assigned to the BSB/Account Number or PayID (by the owner of the PayID)

extendedDescription.description: An extended string description. Only present if specified by the extensionUType field

endToEndId.description: An end to end ID for the payment created at initiation

purposeCode.description: Purpose of the payment.  Format is defined by NPP standards for the x2p1.01 overlay service

accountId.description: ID of the account for which transactions are provided

transactionId.description: A unique ID of the transaction adhering to the standards for ID permanence.

isDetailAvailable.description: True if extended information is available using the transaction detail end point. False if extended data is not available

description.description: The transaction description as applied by the financial institution

postingDateTime.description: The time the transaction was posted. This field is Mandatory if the transaction has status POSTED.  This is the time that appears on a standard statement

valueDateTime.description: Date and time at which assets become available to the account owner in case of a credit entry, or cease to be available to the account owner in case of a debit transaction entry

executionDateTime.description: The time the transaction was executed by the originating customer, if available

amount.description: The value of the transaction. Negative values mean money was outgoing from the account

currency.description: The currency for the transaction amount. AUD assumed if not present

reference.description: The reference for the transaction provided by the originating institution. Empty string if no data provided

merchantName.description: Name of the merchant for an outgoing payment to a merchant

billerCode.description: BPAY Biller Code for the transaction (if available)

billerName.description: Name of the BPAY biller for the transaction (if available)

crn.description: BPAY CRN for the transaction (if available)

self.description: Fully qualified link that generated the current response document

ResponseBankingTransactionByIdV1.description: Response containing a single transaction detail

BankingAccountStatusWithAll.description: Banking Account Status with All Status

billerCode.description: BPAY Biller Code of the Biller

crn.description: BPAY CRN of the Biller. If the contents of the CRN match the format of a Credit Card PAN then it should be masked using the rules applicable for the MaskedPANString common type

accountName.description: Name of the account to pay to

accountNumber.description: Number of the account to pay to

cardNumber.description: Name of the account to pay to

name.description: The name assigned to the PayID by the owner of the PayID

identifier.description: The identifier of the PayID (dependent on type)

BankingDomesticPayeeV1.description: Representation of a Domestic Payee Detail

country.description: Country of the recipient institution. A valid [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code

fedWireNumber.description: Number for Fedwire payment (Federal Reserve Wire Network)

sortCode.description: Sort code used for account identification in some jurisdictions

chipNumber.description: Number for the Clearing House Interbank Payments System

legalEntityIdentifier.description: The legal entity identifier (LEI) for the beneficiary.  Aligns with [ISO 17442](https://www.iso.org/standard/59771.html)

country.description: Country where the beneficiary resides. A valid [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code

BankingInternationalPayeeV1.description: International Payee Beneficiary and Bank Details

BankingPaymentNonBusinessDayTreatment.description: Enumerated field giving the treatment where a scheduled payment date is not a business day. If absent assumed to be ON

accountId.description: ID of the account that is the source of funds for the payment

BankingScheduledPaymentFromV1.description: Object containing details of the source of the payment. Currently only specifies an account ID but provided as an object to facilitate future extensibility and consistency with the to object

interval.description: An interval for the payment. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) with components less than a day in length ignored. This duration defines the period between payments starting with nextPaymentDate

dayInInterval.description: Uses an interval to define the ordinal day within the interval defined by the interval field on which the payment occurs. If the resulting duration is 0 days in length or larger than the number of days in the interval then the payment will occur on the last day of the interval. A duration of 1 day indicates the first day of the interval. If absent the assumed value is P1D. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) with components less than a day in length ignored. The first day of a week is considered to be Monday.

description.description: Description of the event and conditions that will result in the payment. Expected to be formatted for display to a customer

BankingScheduledPaymentRecurrenceEventBa.description: Indicates that the schedule of payments is defined according to an external event that cannot be predetermined. Mandatory if recurrenceUType is set to eventBased

finalPaymentDate.description: The limit date after which no more payments should be made using this schedule. If both finalPaymentDate and paymentsRemaining are present then payments will stop according to the most constraining value. If neither field is present the payments will continue indefinitely

paymentsRemaining.description: Indicates the number of payments remaining in the schedule. If both finalPaymentDate and paymentsRemaining are present then payments will stop according to the most constraining value, If neither field is present the payments will continue indefinitely

intervals.description: An array of interval objects defining the payment schedule.  Each entry in the array is additive, in that it adds payments to the overall payment schedule.  If multiple intervals result in a payment on the same day then only one payment will be made. Must have at least one entry

BankingScheduledPaymentRecurrenceInterva.description: Indicates that the schedule of payments is defined by a series of intervals. Mandatory if recurrenceUType is set to intervalSchedule

finalPaymentDate.description: The limit date after which no more payments should be made using this schedule. If both finalPaymentDate and paymentsRemaining are present then payments will stop according to the most constraining value. If neither field is present the payments will continue indefinitely

paymentsRemaining.description: Indicates the number of payments remaining in the schedule. If both finalPaymentDate and paymentsRemaining are present then payments will stop according to the most constraining value. If neither field is present the payments will continue indefinitely

interval.description: The interval for the payment. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) with components less than a day in length ignored. This duration defines the period between payments starting with nextPaymentDate

BankingScheduledPaymentRecurrenceLastWee.description: Indicates that the schedule of payments is defined according to the last occurrence of a specific weekday in an interval. Mandatory if recurrenceUType is set to lastWeekDay

paymentDate.description: The scheduled date for the once off payment

BankingScheduledPaymentRecurrenceOnceOff.description: Indicates that the payment is a once off payment on a specific future date. Mandatory if recurrenceUType is set to onceOff

nextPaymentDate.description: The date of the next payment under the recurrence schedule

BankingScheduledPaymentRecurrenceV1.description: Describes the detail of the scheduled payment

isAmountCalculated.description: Flag indicating whether the amount of the payment is calculated based on the context of the event. For instance a payment to reduce the balance of a credit card to zero. If absent then false is assumed

amount.description: Flag indicating whether the amount of the payment is calculated based on the context of the event. For instance a payment to reduce the balance of a credit card to zero. If absent then false is assumed

BankingScheduledPaymentSetV1.description: The set of payment amounts and destination accounts for this payment accommodating multi-part payments. A single entry indicates a simple payment with one destination account. Must have at least one entry

accountId.description: Present if toUType is set to accountId. Indicates that the payment is to another account that is accessible under the current consent

payeeId.description: Present if toUType is set to payeeId. Indicates that the payment is to registered payee that can be accessed using the payee end point. If the Bank Payees scope has not been consented to then a payeeId should not be provided and the full payee details should be provided instead

BankingScheduledPaymentToV1.description: Object containing details of the destination of the payment. Used to specify a variety of payment destination types

scheduledPaymentId.description: A unique ID of the scheduled payment adhering to the standards for ID permanence

nickname.description: The short display name of the payee as provided by the customer

payerReference.description: The reference for the transaction that will be used by the originating institution for the purposes of constructing a statement narrative on the payer’s account. Empty string if no data provided

payeeReference.description: The reference for the transaction that will be provided by the originating institution. Empty string if no data provided

PayloadTypeBankingDomesticPayeePayId.description: Payload Type: Domestic Payee PayID Identifier Type

PayloadTypeBankingScheduledPaymentRecurr.description: Payload Type: Banking Scheduled Payment Recurrence

PayloadTypeBankingScheduledPaymentTo.description: Payload Type: Banking Scheduled Payment Target

scheduledPayments.description: The list of scheduled payments to return

ResponseBankingScheduledPaymentsListData.description: An object containing a list of BankingScheduledPayment objects

ResponseBankingScheduledPaymentsListV1.description: Response containing a data object with BankingScheduledPayment lists

code.description: Must be one of the following: 0001 – Account not able to be found

title.description: Must be one of the following: Invalid account

detail.description: ID of the account not found

meta.description: Optional additional data for specific error types

RequestAccountIdsV1.description: Request containing a set of Account IDs

amount.description: The balance available for this additional currency purse

BankingBalancePurseV1.description: An Australian Bank Account Purse Balance Representation

accountId.description: A unique ID of the account adhering to the standards for ID permanence

currentBalance.description: The balance of the account at this time. Should align to the balance available via other channels such as Internet Banking. Assumed to be negative if the customer has money owing

availableBalance.description: Balance representing the amount of funds available for transfer. Assumed to be zero or positive

creditLimit.description: Object representing the maximum amount of credit that is available for this account. Assumed to be zero if absent

amortisedLimit.description: Object representing the available limit amortised according to payment schedule. Assumed to be zero if absent

currency.description: The currency for the balance amounts. If absent assumed to be AUD

purses.description: Optional array of balances for the account in other currencies. Included to support accounts that support multi-currency purses such as Travel Cards

BankingBalanceV1.description: A Representation of a Banking Account Balance

balances.description: The list of accounts returned. If the filter results in an empty set then this array may have no records

ResponseBankingAccountsBalanceListDataV1.description: Response containing a list of BankingBalance objects

ResponseBankingAccountsBalanceListV1.description: Response containing a Banking Accounts Balances List

payeeId.description: ID of the payee adhering to the rules of ID permanence

nickname.description: The short display name of the payee as provided by the customer

description.description: A description of the payee provided by the customer

creationDate.description: The date the payee was created by the customer

ResponseBankingPayeeListDataV1.description: Object containing a list of BankingPayee objects

ResponseBankingPayeeListV1.description: Response containing a Banking Payee List

payeeId.description: ID of the payee adhering to the rules of ID permanence

nickname.description: The short display name of the payee as provided by the customer

description.description: A description of the payee provided by the customer

creationDate.description: The date the payee was created by the customer

ResponseBankingPayeeByIdV1.description: Response containing a Banking Payee By Identifier

description.description: Description of the authorised entity derived from previously executed direct debits

financialInstitution.description: Name of the financial institution through which the direct debit will be executed. Is required unless the payment is made via a credit card scheme

abn.description: Australian Business Number for the authorised entity

acn.description: Australian Company Number for the authorised entity

arbn.description: Australian Registered Body Number for the authorised entity

accountId.description: A unique ID of the account adhering to the standards for ID permanence.

lastDebitDateTime.description: The date and time of the last debit executed under this authorisation

lastDebitAmount.description: The amount of the last debit executed under this authorisation

BankingDirectDebitV1.description: Representation of a Direct Debit Authorisation

ResponseBankingDirectDebitAuthorisationL.description: Object containing a list of BankingDirectDebit objects
Response containing a a list of Direct Debit Authorisations

accountId.description: A unique ID of the account adhering to the standards for ID permanence

creationDate.description: Date that the account was created (if known)

displayName.description: The display name of the account as defined by the bank. This should not incorporate account numbers or PANs. If it does the values should be masked according to the rules of the MaskedAccountString common type.

nickname.description: A customer supplied nick name for the account

isOwned.description: Flag indicating that the customer associated with the authorisation is an owner of the account. Does not indicate sole ownership, however. If not present then 'true' is assumed

maskedNumber.description: A masked version of the account. Whether BSB/Account Number, Credit Card PAN or another number

productName.description: The unique identifier of the account as defined by the account holder (akin to model number for the account)

accounts.description: The list of accounts returned. If the filter results in an empty set then this array may have no records

ResponseBankingAccountListDataV1.description: Response containing a list of Banking Accounts

ResponseBankingAccountListV1.description: Response containing a list of Banking Accounts

AddressPAFFlatUnitType.description: Type of flat or unit for the address

AddressPAFFloorLevelType.description: Floor or level type for the address

AddressPAFPostalDeliveryType.description: Postal Delivery Type for the Address

accountId.description: A unique ID of the account adhering to the standards for ID permanence

creationDate.description: Date that the account was created (if known)

displayName.description: The display name of the account as defined by the bank. This should not incorporate account numbers or PANs. If it does the values should be masked according to the rules of the MaskedAccountString common type.

nickname.description: A customer supplied nick name for the account

isOwned.description: Flag indicating that the customer associated with the authorisation is an owner of the account. Does not indicate sole ownership, however. If not present then 'true' is assumed

maskedNumber.description: A masked version of the account. Whether BSB/Account Number, Credit Card PAN or another number

productName.description: The unique identifier of the account as defined by the account holder (akin to model number for the account)

bsb.description: The unmasked BSB for the account. Is expected to be formatted as digits only with leading zeros included and no punctuation or spaces

accountNumber.description: The unmasked account number for the account. Should not be supplied if the account number is a PAN requiring PCI compliance. Is expected to be formatted as digits only with leading zeros included and no punctuation or spaces

bundleName.description: Optional field to indicate if this account is part of a bundle that is providing additional benefit for to the customer

depositRate.description: current rate to calculate interest earned being applied to deposit balances as it stands at the time of the API call

lendingRate.description: The current rate to calculate interest payable being applied to lending balances as it stands at the time of the API call

depositRates.description: Fully described deposit rates for this account based on the equivalent structure in Product Reference

lendingRates.description: Fully described deposit rates for this account based on the equivalent structure in Product Reference

features.description: Array of features of the account based on the equivalent structure in Product Reference with the following additional field

fees.description: Fees and charges applicable to the account based on the equivalent structure in Product Reference

addresses.description: The addresses for the account to be used for correspondence

additionalValue.description: Generic field containing additional information relevant to the [featureType](#tocSproductfeaturetypedoc) specified. Whether mandatory or not is dependent on the value of the [featureType.](#tocSproductfeaturetypedoc)

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the feature. Mandatory if the [feature type](#tocSproductfeaturetypedoc) is set to OTHER

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this feature

isActivated.description: True if the feature is already activated and false if the feature is available for activation.

minPaymentAmount.description: The minimum payment amount due for the next card payment

paymentDueAmount.description: The amount due for the next card payment

paymentDueDate.description: Date that the next payment for the card is due

loanEndDate.description: Date that the loan is due to be repaid in full

nextInstalmentDate.description: Next date that an instalment is required

maxRedraw.description: Maximum amount of funds that can be redrawn. If not present redraw is not available even if the feature exists for the account

offsetAccountEnabled.description: Set to true if one or more offset accounts are configured for this loan account

offsetAccountIds.description: The accountIDs of the configured offset accounts attached to this loan. Only offset accounts that can be accessed under the current authorisation should be included. It is expected behaviour that offsetAccountEnabled is set to true but the offsetAccountIds field is absent or empty. This represents a situation where an offset account exists but details can not be accessed under the current authorisation

items.description: The accountIDs of the configured offset accounts attached to this loan. Only offset accounts that can be accessed under the current authorisation should be included. It is expected behaviour that offsetAccountEnabled is set to true but the offsetAccountIds field is absent or empty. This represents a situation where an offset account exists but details can not be accessed under the current authorisation

repaymentFrequency.description: The expected or required repayment frequency. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations)

calculationFrequency.description: The period after which the rate is applied to the balance to calculate the amount due for the period. Calculation of the amount is often daily (as balances may change) but accumulated until the total amount is 'applied' to the account (see applicationFrequency). Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations)

applicationFrequency.description: The period after which the calculated amount(s) (see calculationFrequency) are 'applied' (i.e. debited or credited) to the account. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations)

tiers.description: Rate tiers applicable for this rate

additionalValue.description: Generic field containing additional information relevant to the [depositRateType](#tocSproductdepositratetypedoc) specified. Whether mandatory or not is dependent on the value of [depositRateType](#tocSproductdepositratetypedoc)

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the rate

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this rate

BankingProductDepositRateV1.description: A Description of a Deposit Rate

amount.description: Value of the discount. When following properties include one of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate, accruedRate and feeRate is mandatory

balanceRate.description: A discount rate calculated based on a proportion of the balance. Note that the currency of the fee discount is expected to be the same as the currency of the fee itself. One of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate, accruedRate and feeRate is mandatory. Unless noted in additionalInfo, assumes the application and calculation frequency are the same as the corresponding fee

transactionRate.description: A discount rate calculated based on a proportion of a transaction. Note that the currency of the fee discount is expected to be the same as the currency of the fee itself. One of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate, accruedRate and feeRate is mandatory

accruedRate.description: A discount rate calculated based on a proportion of the calculated interest accrued on the account. Note that the currency of the fee discount is expected to be the same as the currency of the fee itself. One of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate, accruedRate and feeRate is mandatory. Unless noted in additionalInfo, assumes the application and calculation frequency are the same as the corresponding fee

feeRate.description: A discount rate calculated based on a proportion of the fee to which this discount is attached. Note that the currency of the fee discount is expected to be the same as the currency of the fee itself. One of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate, accruedRate and feeRate is mandatory. Unless noted in additionalInfo, assumes the application and calculation frequency are the same as the corresponding fee

additionalValue.description: Generic field containing additional information relevant to the [discountType](#tocSproductdiscounttypedoc) specified. Whether mandatory or not is dependent on the value of [discountType](#tocSproductdiscounttypedoc)

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the discount

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this discount

eligibility.description: Eligibility constraints that apply to this discount

additionalValue.description: Generic field containing additional information relevant to the [featureType](#tocSproductfeaturetypedoc) specified. Whether mandatory or not is dependent on the value of the [featureType.](#tocSproductfeaturetypedoc)

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the feature. Mandatory if the [feature type](#tocSproductfeaturetypedoc) is set to OTHER

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this feature

additionalValue.description: Additional Value for Eligibility Constraint related to Discount

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on this eligibility constraint

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this eligibility constraint

amount.description: The amount charged for the fee. One of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate and accruedRate is mandatory

balanceRate.description: A fee rate calculated based on a proportion of the balance. One of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate and accruedRate is mandatory

transactionRate.description: A fee rate calculated based on a proportion of a transaction. One of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate and accruedRate is mandatory

accruedRate.description: A fee rate calculated based on a proportion of the calculated interest accrued on the account. One of amount, balanceRate, transactionRate and accruedRate is mandatory

accrualFrequency.description: The indicative frequency with which the fee is calculated on the account. Only applies if balanceRate or accruedRate is also present. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations)

currency.description: The currency the fee will be charged in

additionalValue.description: Generic field containing additional information relevant to the [feeType](#tocSproductfeetypedoc) specified. Whether mandatory or not is dependent on the value of [feeType](#tocSproductfeetypedoc)

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the fee

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this fee

discounts.description: An optional list of discounts to this fee that may be available

BankingProductLendingRateInterestPayment.description: Banking Product Lending Rate Interest Payment Configuration

comparisonRate.description: A comparison rate equivalent for this rate

calculationFrequency.description: The period after which the rate is applied to the balance to calculate the amount due for the period. Calculation of the amount is often daily (as balances may change) but accumulated until the total amount is 'applied' to the account (see applicationFrequency). Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations)

applicationFrequency.description: The period after which the calculated amount(s) (see calculationFrequency) are 'applied' (i.e. debited or credited) to the account. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations)

tiers.description: Rate tiers applicable for this rate

additionalValue.description: Generic field containing additional information relevant to the [lendingRateType](#tocSproductlendingratetypedoc) specified. Whether mandatory or not is dependent on the value of [lendingRateType](#tocSproductlendingratetypedoc)

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the rate.

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this rate

BankingProductRateTierApplicationMethod.description: Banking Product: Rate Tier Application Method

name.description: A display name for the tier

minimumValue.description: The number of tierUnitOfMeasure units that form the lower bound of the tier. The tier should be inclusive of this value

maximumValue.description: The number of tierUnitOfMeasure units that form the upper bound of the tier or band. For a tier with a discrete value (as opposed to a range of values e.g. 1 month) this must be the same as tierValueMinimum. Where this is the same as the tierValueMinimum value of the next-higher tier the referenced tier should be exclusive of this value. For example a term deposit of 2 months falls into the upper tier of the following tiers: (1 – 2 months, 2 – 3 months). If absent the tier's range has no upper bound.

BankingProductRateTierV1.description: Defines the criteria and conditions for which a rate applies

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the condition

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this condition

BankingRateTierApplicabilityV1.description: Defines a condition for the applicability of a tiered rate

lodgementDate.description: The lodgement date of the original deposit

maturityDate.description: Maturity date for the term deposit

maturityAmount.description: Amount to be paid upon maturity. If absent it implies the amount to paid is variable and cannot currently be calculated

dpid.description: Unique identifier for an address as defined by Australia Post.  Also known as Delivery Point Identifier

thoroughfareNumber1.description: Thoroughfare number for a property (first number in a property ranged address)

thoroughfareNumber1Suffix.description: Suffix for the thoroughfare number. Only relevant is thoroughfareNumber1 is populated

thoroughfareNumber2.description: Second thoroughfare number (only used if the property has a ranged address eg 23-25)

thoroughfareNumber2Suffix.description: Suffix for the second thoroughfare number. Only relevant is thoroughfareNumber2 is populated

floorLevelNumber.description: Floor or level number (including alpha characters)

postalDeliveryNumber.description: Postal delivery number if the address is a postal delivery type

postalDeliveryNumberPrefix.description: Postal delivery number prefix related to the postal delivery number

postalDeliveryNumberSuffix.description: Postal delivery number suffix related to the postal delivery number

CommonPAFAddressV1.description: Australian address formatted according to the file format defined by the [PAF file format](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf)

mailingName.description: Name of the individual or business formatted for inclusion in an address used for physical mail

addressLine1.description: First line of the standard address object

addressLine2.description: Second line of the standard address object

addressLine3.description: Third line of the standard address object

city.description: Name of the city or locality

state.description: Free text if the country is not Australia. If country is Australia then must be one of the values defined by the [State Type Abbreviation](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf) in the PAF file format. NSW, QLD, VIC, NT, WA, SA, TAS, ACT, AAT

country.description: A valid [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code. Australia (AUS) is assumed if country is not present.

ResponseBankingAccountByIdV1.description: Response containing a single Banking Account Detail

lastUpdateTime.description: The date and time that this record was last updated by the customer. If no update has occurred then this date should reflect the initial creation date for the data

agentFirstName.description: The first name of the individual providing access on behalf of the organisation. For people with single names this field need not be present.  The single name should be in the lastName field

agentLastName.description: The last name of the individual providing access on behalf of the organisation. For people with single names the single name should be in this field

agentRole.description: The role of the individual identified as the agent who is providing authorisation.  Expected to be used for display.  Default to “Unspecified” if the role is not known

legalName.description: Legal name, if different to the business name

shortName.description: Short name used for communication, if  different to the business name

abn.description: Australian Business Number for the organisation

acn.description: Australian Company Number for the organisation. Required only if an ACN is applicable for the organisation type

isACNCRegistered.description: True if registered with the ACNC.  False if not. Absent or null if not confirmed.

registeredCountry.description: Enumeration with values from [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country codes.  Assumed to be AUS if absent

establishmentDate.description: The date the organisation described was established

lastUpdateTime.description: The date and time that this record was last updated by the customer.  If no update has occurred then this date should reflect the initial creation date for the data

firstName.description: For people with single names this field need not be present.  The single name should be in the lastName field

lastName.description: For people with single names the single name should be in this field

middleNames.description: Field is mandatory but array may be empty

items.description: Field is mandatory but array may be empty

prefix.description: Also known as title or salutation.  The prefix to the name (e.g. Mr, Mrs, Ms, Miss, Sir, etc)

suffix.description: Used for a trailing suffix to the name (e.g. Jr)

occupationCode.description: Value is a valid [ANZCO v1.2](http://www.abs.gov.au/ANZSCO) Standard Occupation classification.

ResponseCommonCustomerDataV1.description: Object containing either a CommonPerson or CommonOrganisation object defineed by a type

ResponseCommonCustomerV1.description: Response containing a data object with customer details of either PERSON or ORGANISATION object

address.description: A correctly formatted email address, as defined by the addr_spec format in [RFC 5322](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5322.txt)

isPreferred.description: May be true for one and only one email record in the collection. Denotes the default email address

lastUpdateTime.description: The date and time that this record was last updated by the customer. If no update has occurred then this date should reflect the initial creation date for the data

agentFirstName.description: The first name of the individual providing access on behalf of the organisation. For people with single names this field need not be present.  The single name should be in the lastName field

agentLastName.description: The last name of the individual providing access on behalf of the organisation. For people with single names the single name should be in this field

agentRole.description: The role of the individual identified as the agent who is providing authorisation.  Expected to be used for display.  Default to “Unspecified” if the role is not known

legalName.description: Legal name, if different to the business name

shortName.description: Short name used for communication, if  different to the business name

abn.description: Australian Business Number for the organisation

acn.description: Australian Company Number for the organisation. Required only if an ACN is applicable for the organisation type

isACNCRegistered.description: True if registered with the ACNC.  False if not. Absent or null if not confirmed.

registeredCountry.description: Enumeration with values from [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country codes.  Assumed to be AUS if absent

establishmentDate.description: The date the organisation described was established

physicalAddresses.description: Must contain at least one address. One and only one address may have the purpose of REGISTERED. Zero or one, and no more than one, record may have the purpose of MAIL. If zero then the REGISTERED address is to be used for mail

lastUpdateTime.description: The date and time that this record was last updated by the customer.  If no update has occurred then this date should reflect the initial creation date for the data

firstName.description: For people with single names this field need not be present.  The single name should be in the lastName field

lastName.description: For people with single names the single name should be in this field

middleNames.description: Field is mandatory but array may be empty

items.description: Field is mandatory but array may be empty

prefix.description: Also known as title or salutation.  The prefix to the name (e.g. Mr, Mrs, Ms, Miss, Sir, etc)

suffix.description: Used for a trailing suffix to the name (e.g. Jr)

occupationCode.description: Value is a valid [ANZCO v1.2](http://www.abs.gov.au/ANZSCO) Standard Occupation classification.

phoneNumbers.description: Array is mandatory but may be empty if no phone numbers are held

physicalAddresses.description: Must contain at least one address. One and only one address may have the purpose of REGISTERED. Zero or one, and no more than one, record may have the purpose of MAIL. If zero then the REGISTERED address is to be used for mail

isPreferred.description: May be true for one and only one entry to indicate the preferred phone number. Assumed to be 'false' if not present

countryCode.description: If absent, assumed to be Australia (+61). The + should be included

areaCode.description: Required for non Mobile Phones, if field is present and refers to Australian code - the leading 0 should be omitted.

number.description: The actual phone number, with leading zeros as appropriate

fullNumber.description: Fully formatted phone number with country code, area code, number and extension incorporated. Formatted according to section 5.1.4. of [RFC 3966](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3966.txt)

ResponseCommonCustomerDetailData.description: Object containing either a PersonDetail or OrganisationDetail object defined by a type attribute

outageTime.description: Date and time that the outage is scheduled to begin

duration.description: Planned duration of the outage. Formatted according to [ISO 8601 Durations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations)

isPartial.description: Flag that indicates, if present and set to true, that the outage is only partial meaning that only a subset of normally available end points will be affected by the outage

explanation.description: Provides an explanation of the current outage that can be displayed to an end customer

outages.description: List of scheduled outages. Property is mandatory but may contain and empty list if no outages are scheduled

DiscoveryOutage.description: Object containing a list of CommonDiscoveryOutage objects

updatedTime.description: The date and time that this status was last updated by the Data Holder.

explanation.description: Provides an explanation of the current outage that can be displayed to an end customer. Mandatory if the status property is any value other than OK

detectionTime.description: The date and time that the current outage was detected. Should only be present if the status property is PARTIAL_FAILURE or UNAVAILABLE

expectedResolutionTime.description: The date and time that full service is expected to resume (if known). Should not be present if the status property has a value of OK.

BankingProductEffectiveWithAll.description: Banking Product Effective Filter with All

termsUri.description: Terms and conditions for the product

eligibilityUri.description: Eligibility rules and criteria for the product

feesAndPricingUri.description: Description of fees, pricing, discounts, exemptions and bonuses for the product

bundleUri.description: Description of a bundle that this product can be part of

BankingProductAdditionalInformationV1.description: Object that contains links to additional information on specific topics

title.description: Display label for the specific image

imageUri.description: Link to a PNG, JPG or GIF image with proportions defined by ISO 7810 ID-1 and width no greater than 512 pixels

productId.description: A data holder specific unique identifier for this product. This identifier must be unique to a product but does not otherwise need to adhere to ID permanence guidelines.

effectiveFrom.description: The date and time from which this product is effective (ie. is available for origination).  Used to enable the articulation of products to the regime before they are available for customers to originate

effectiveTo.description: The date and time at which this product will be retired and will no longer be offered.  Used to enable the managed deprecation of products

lastUpdated.description: The last date and time that the information for this product was changed (or the creation date for the product if it has never been altered)

name.description: The display name of the product

brand.description: A label of the brand for the product. Able to be used for filtering. For data holders with single brands this value is still required

brandName.description: An optional display name of the brand

applicationUri.description: A link to an application web page where this product can be applied for.

isTailored.description: Indicates whether the product is specifically tailored to a circumstance.  In this case fees and prices are significantly negotiated depending on context. While all products are open to a degree of tailoring this flag indicates that tailoring is expected and thus that the provision of specific fees and rates is not applicable

cardArt.description: An array of card art images

ResponseBankingPayeeListV2.description: Response containing a Banking Payee List

products.description: The list of products returned.  If the filter results in an empty set then this array may have no records

ResponseBankingProductListDataV2.description: Object containing a list of BankingProduct objects

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the bundle

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on the bundle criteria and benefits

productIds.description: Array of product IDs for products included in the bundle that are available via the product end points.  Note that this array is not intended to represent a comprehensive model of the products included in the bundle and some products available for the bundle may not be available via the product reference end points

items.description: Array of product IDs for products included in the bundle that are available via the product end points.  Note that this array is not intended to represent a comprehensive model of the products included in the bundle and some products available for the bundle may not be available via the product reference end points

additionalValue.description: Generic field containing additional information relevant to the [constraintType](#tocSproductconstrainttypedoc) specified.  Whether mandatory or not is dependent on the value of [constraintType](#tocSproductconstrainttypedoc)

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information the constraint

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on the constraint

productId.description: A data holder specific unique identifier for this product. This identifier must be unique to a product but does not otherwise need to adhere to ID permanence guidelines.

effectiveFrom.description: The date and time from which this product is effective (ie. is available for origination).  Used to enable the articulation of products to the regime before they are available for customers to originate

effectiveTo.description: The date and time at which this product will be retired and will no longer be offered.  Used to enable the managed deprecation of products

lastUpdated.description: The last date and time that the information for this product was changed (or the creation date for the product if it has never been altered)

name.description: The display name of the product

brand.description: A label of the brand for the product. Able to be used for filtering. For data holders with single brands this value is still required

brandName.description: An optional display name of the brand

applicationUri.description: A link to an application web page where this product can be applied for.

isTailored.description: Indicates whether the product is specifically tailored to a circumstance.  In this case fees and prices are significantly negotiated depending on context. While all products are open to a degree of tailoring this flag indicates that tailoring is expected and thus that the provision of specific fees and rates is not applicable

bundles.description: An array of bundles that this product participates in.  Each bundle is described by free form information but also by a list of product IDs of the other products that are included in the bundle.  It is assumed that the current product is included in the bundle also

features.description: Array of features available for the product

constraints.description: Constraints on the application for or operation of the product such as minimum balances or limit thresholds

lendingRates.description: Interest rates charged against lending balances

additionalValue.description: Generic field containing additional information relevant to the [eligibilityType](#tocSproducteligibilitytypedoc) specified.  Whether mandatory or not is dependent on the value of [eligibilityType](#tocSproducteligibilitytypedoc)

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the eligibility criteria. Mandatory if the [eligibilityType](#tocSproducteligibilitytypedoc) field is set to OTHER

additionalInfoUri.description: Link to a web page with more information on this eligibility criteria

BankingProductEligibilityV1.description: Eligibility criteria to obtain a particular banking product

ResponseBankingProductByIdV1.description: Response containing a single BankingProductDetail entry

productId.description: A data holder specific unique identifier for this product. This identifier must be unique to a product but does not otherwise need to adhere to ID permanence guidelines.

effectiveFrom.description: The date and time from which this product is effective (ie. is available for origination).  Used to enable the articulation of products to the regime before they are available for customers to originate

effectiveTo.description: The date and time at which this product will be retired and will no longer be offered.  Used to enable the managed deprecation of products

lastUpdated.description: The last date and time that the information for this product was changed (or the creation date for the product if it has never been altered)

name.description: The display name of the product

brand.description: A label of the brand for the product. Able to be used for filtering. For data holders with single brands this value is still required

brandName.description: An optional display name of the brand

applicationUri.description: A link to an application web page where this product can be applied for.

isTailored.description: Indicates whether the product is specifically tailored to a circumstance.  In this case fees and prices are significantly negotiated depending on context. While all products are open to a degree of tailoring this flag indicates that tailoring is expected and thus that the provision of specific fees and rates is not applicable

cardArt.description: An array of card art images

bundles.description: An array of bundles that this product participates in.  Each bundle is described by free form information but also by a list of product IDs of the other products that are included in the bundle.  It is assumed that the current product is included in the bundle also

features.description: Array of features available for the product

constraints.description: Constraints on the application for or operation of the product such as minimum balances or limit thresholds

lendingRates.description: Interest rates charged against lending balances

ResponseBankingProductByIdV2.description: Response containing a single BankingProductDetail entry
